properties.name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

properties.description: A chronic suppurative and cicatricial disease of the apocrine glands occurring chiefly in the axillae in women and in the groin and anal regions in men. It is characterized by poral occlusion with secondary bacterial infection, evolving into abscesses which eventually rupture. As the disease becomes chronic, ulcers appear, sinus tracts enlarge, fistulas develop, and fibrosis and scarring become evident.

Finally doing my thread on HS. It’ll be a combination of 3 abnormalities with the sweat glands: 

- Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS)
- Hyperhidrosis (primary and secondary)
- Body odor (Bromhidrosis)

I’ll also finally be reviewing the @necessaire deodorant after 7 months of use!

Research Fellowship in Inflammatory Skin Diseases & Health Equity. If interested please forward your CV with Step 1/2 scores and cover letter to lauren.orenstein@emory.edu. Deadline is April 21st;  applications will be considered on a rolling basis. Anticipated start: Summer 2021 https://t.co/FFIX57jmZp

@BrittGratreak For me, it’s not so much a symptom, but a comorbidity. I need someone to study Hidradenitis Suppurativa, Behcet’s, and dry eye/mouth. In Behcet’s support groups those two come up a lot, and when I probe, most with one also the have the other. My hunch is it’s a missed phenotype.
